about.summary: The 'ggplot2' package is excellent and flexible for elegant data visualization in R. However the default generated plots requires some formatting before we can send them for publication. Furthermore, to customize a 'ggplot', the syntax is opaque and this raises the level of difficulty for researchers with no advanced R programming skills. 'ggpubr' provides some easy-to-use functions for creating and customizing 'ggplot2'- based publication ready plots.

The 'ggplot2' package is excellent and flexible for elegant data visualization in R. However the default generated plots requires some formatting before we can send them for publication. Furthermore, to customize a 'ggplot', the syntax is opaque and this raises the level of difficulty for researchers with no advanced R programming skills. 'ggpubr' provides some easy-to-use functions for creating and customizing 'ggplot2'- based publication ready plots.

name: r-ggpubr
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.6.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-ggpubr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/ggpubr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/ggpubr/ggpubr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: c31a65edc4cae7fc515e47dda3e29a4f7aba6040f0a54e148cf9e9f887b3839f

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-cowplot
    - r-dplyr >=0.7.1
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-ggrepel
    - r-ggsci
    - r-ggsignif
    - r-glue
    - r-gridextra
    - r-magrittr
    - r-polynom
    - r-purrr
    - r-rlang
    - r-scales
    - r-tidyr
    - r-rstatix
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-cowplot
    - r-dplyr >=0.7.1
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-ggrepel
    - r-ggsci
    - r-ggsignif
    - r-glue
    - r-gridextra
    - r-magrittr
    - r-polynom
    - r-purrr
    - r-rlang
    - r-scales
    - r-tidyr
    - r-rstatix

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('ggpubr')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('ggpubr')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://rpkgs.datanovia.com/ggpubr/
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: The 'ggplot2' package is excellent and flexible for elegant data visualization in R. However the default generated plots requires some formatting before we can send them for publication. Furthermore, to customize a 'ggplot', the syntax is opaque and this raises the level of difficulty for researchers with no advanced
    R programming skills. 'ggpubr' provides some easy-to-use functions for creating and customizing 'ggplot2'- based publication ready plots.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: ggpubr
# Type: Package
# Title: 'ggplot2' Based Publication Ready Plots
# Version: 0.2.3
# Date: 2019-09-03
# Authors@R: c( person("Alboukadel", "Kassambara", role = c("aut", "cre"), email = "alboukadel.kassambara@gmail.com"))
# Description: The 'ggplot2' package is excellent and flexible for elegant data visualization in R. However the default generated plots requires some formatting before we can send them for publication. Furthermore, to customize a 'ggplot', the syntax is opaque and this raises the level of difficulty for researchers with no advanced R programming skills. 'ggpubr' provides some easy-to-use functions for creating and customizing 'ggplot2'- based publication ready plots.
